info.headline: Flood Warning issued May 14 at 6:30AM EDT until May 17 at 8:00AM EDT by NWS Columbia SC
info.description:
...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in South Carolina...
Congaree River At Congaree River at Congaree NP Near Gadsden affecting Richland and Calhoun Counties.
Congaree River At Carolina Eastman affecting Richland, Calhoun and Lexington Counties.
Saluda River At Saluda River at Chappells affecting Saluda, Greenwood and Newberry Counties.
* WHAT...Moderate flooding is occurring and moderate flooding is forecast.
* WHERE...Congaree River at Carolina Eastman.
* WHEN...Until Saturday morning.
* IMPACTS...At 115.0 feet, Flooding occurs in low lying areas of the Carolina Eastman Facility and at the Congaree National Park. At 119.0 feet, Extensive flooding occurs in the Congaree National Park. Some area farmland is flooded. Minor flooding occurs at the Carolina Eastman Facility.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 5:45 AM EDT Wednesday the stage was 119.2 feet. - Bankfull stage is 114.0 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 5:45 AM EDT Wednesday was 119.2 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 120.1 feet just after midnight tonight. It will then fall below flood stage Friday morning. - Flood stage is 115.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction:
Residents and those with interests near the river should monitor rising water levels and take action if necessary.
Flooded roadways are nearly impossible to see at night. Avoid traveling in this area. Turn around, don't drown.
Most flooding deaths occur in vehicles. Never drive through a flooded roadway or around barricades. Turn around, don't drown.
Additional information is available at www.weather.gov.
The next statement will be issued this evening at 630 PM EDT.

parameter.value: FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL SATURDAY MORNING

area.areaDesc: Calhoun, SC; Lexington, SC; Richland, SC
